ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] LEHP!!! Fear song....
ygData.msgSnippet: ROFL Screech has a permanent spot in my song bank :)  Perm songs that NEVER get un-memmed Charm/Bravura (they get swapped depending on what area I m in,
ygData.messageBody:
ROFL

Screech has a permanent spot in my song bank :) Perm songs that NEVER get
un-memmed

Charm/Bravura (they get swapped depending on what area I'm in, sometimes ya
just don't NEED da manahog)
Screech

(Hymn used to, lately it's been coming out sometimes though)
(Clarity is almost always in but will get taken out if no casters in group
**RARE** or I'm soloing)
All others are subject to change on a moment-moment basis. But those two up
top are NEVER un-memmed (and lately I've just been leaving Bravura in)

Fear is just too damn useful (as is charm) to risk un-memming it. The one
time you remove it is going to be the time you need it.

----- Original Message -----
From: "Elijah Meeker" <emeeker@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, July 11, 2000 1:15 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] LEHP!!! Fear song....


>
> > More uses:
> > Crowd control: Pull mob to the side, chain, fear, chain, go back to
> > fighting while the mob wanders around a bit.
>
> In the Lake of Ill Omen if you accidently get multis while soloing you can
> fear them,only chaining one and finish the chained one off while the
others
> wander (sometimes it takes two tries to get them lost). Sit and heal, then
> wander around a bit until one of the others finds you. If you get more
than
> one back, repeat.
> As a side benefit, if one of them was a sarnak he will often pass you on
to
> allll the other sarnaks, and you will get faction hits for the rest of the
> night (assuming the fort is under siege). I know what you are thinking,
but
> I never got a train back from this strategy.
>
> >Save party: Evac'er needs time to cast: AE FEAR gate goes off, no
train
>
> Oohhh, the times this has saved my group's butt, and oooh the times I
needed
> it and my last thought before dying was 'screech isn't memmed"...I have
> pretty much decided that if there is a need for an evacer then there is a
> need to have screech and a horn ready.
>
> Tszaaz(Povar)/Tsengu(Nameless)
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
